name: Empire Hotel

reviews.text: If it weren't for the ridiculous bathrooms, this would be a very good place to stay IF you get a standard room for under $200. However, due to a "safety issue" (I asked), half the shower door has been removed in all bathrooms and as a result, the entire small bathroom gets completely soaked, and I mean soaked, when you take a shower. Won't stay here again knowing that I have to spend ten minutes mopping up the lake that forms after every shower.
reviews.title: Bathroom Soaker

reviews.text: This was a pretty neat hotel and it had a club on the top floor that was really hopping on the weekend on Saturday night. Subway was really close and the concierges were very helpful and many places right around the corner to eat and a short walk to central park!!
reviews.title: Nice location for NYC

reviews.text: The Empire Hotel is a good hotel, in a good location. The public interiors are quite heavy and dark but sexy, and the animal print soft furnishings may need a re-think, however the bar area is always buzzing - mainly because the hotel is opposite the opera. The rooms are of a good size with neutral tones, but the open wardrobe space with only 3 hangar space is not ideal. The fitness area was the biggest let down and needs an update asap, as the amount of equipment does not suffice to a hotel of this size. If you want to stay uptown you could do a lost worse than staying at the Empire however be prepared for long taxi rides downtown with drivers often hesitant to drive all the way back to Lincoln Sq.
reviews.title: Buzzing

reviews.text: We have just left this hotel after staying for 3 nights and i felt compelled to warn other people to stay away. I rarely review hotels on trip advisor. The place is dirty, i questioned if the room had been cleaned before we arrived (shampoo in shower half use etc). The staff are rude and super unhelpful and just tell you anything you want to hear so that you stop asking questions. The one plus side was the hotel restaurant where the staff were actually polite and service was great.
reviews.title: A really terrible experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are so many amazing hotels in New York to stay, i would recommend that anyone traveling here keep looking when you come across this place.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: Went to the Empire hotel with some friends for a stag party weekend and I loved it. Beautiful rooms, great suites and the hotel bar is great. The location is also very good for NYC close to everything. The suite was not very big but for NYC it was perfect for a group of friends to have a descent party.
reviews.title: Great suites

reviews.text: Amazing hotel, very SEXY !! The lobby is beautiful, rooms are very chic with Locittane products in the bathroom. We loved the location, 15-20 min walking to Times square, the hotel is atLincoln centre with a lot of shops around, few minutes walk to Central park. Right next to the hotel you have very good restaraunt - The Smith. You must try their gnocchi - the best i ever ate. The rooftop at the hotel is gorgeous, the view is fantastic, the service is just ok. They have an open space (for smokers i guess )and close space. We loved it!! I would choose this hotel again at my next stay!
reviews.title: My hotel in NYC !!!

reviews.text: 10 of us recently stayed at the Hotel Empire in New York City. We were there the weekend of November 16th, 2012. Booking on line sight unseen, none of us were disappointed. The hotel was beautiful, comfortable and a hotspot with the rooftop bar. The employees were more than helpful and we were greeted with smiles every day. The rooms were clean and the location was perfect for us. I would go back in a heartbeat.
reviews.title: DOESN'T DISAPPOINT

reviews.text: I spent a couple of nights in November 2012 for a business trip at Empire Hotel. I has stayed there before, and was happy. Check in was easy, and staff/concierge were very helpful. (The concierge had spent a few hours locating speedo swimwear for another guest earlier that day and was excited to have found it!). I asked for a higher floor room and did get it. My room was small (on par with NYC rooms), but had a great view. Bathroom was also small, but loved the rain shower, and the aminities. There was a faint constant banging noise around the hallway on my floor, but couldn't hear it in the room.
reviews.title: Good Hotel, Great Location

reviews.text: One issue: on the 2nd day, my bathroom wasn't clean properly. I didn't have enough towels, and the toilet wasn't clean.
reviews.title: Would stay at Hotel Empire again

reviews.text: I was just about to write the hotel a letter about my recent stay, but thought it might be more effective to simply warn others away.
reviews.title: A hotel so bad that I literally cried - rooms not safe!
Good hotel with a great rooftop bar.
reviews.text: I recently had a one-night stay at The Empire. It was my second stay at the property, which is one of the preferred properties of my company. My first stay was unfortunate, loud, and tainted by really lackluster service. However, last week's stay was tear-inducing.

Like @alsmith031's post below, I showed up for my non-smoking reservation and was "tricked" into a smoking room on the 4th floor. When I called to ask to be switched, I was told that no other rooms were available. (Even though I had checked in late, and had a mere one-night reservation.)
reviews.title: Too much noise

reviews.text: When I physically went to the front desk with my luggage, they miraculously found another room. This time, I was placed in a shoddy room on their first floor. Shoddy, dark, and depressing. But, hey, it's just for one night - what could go wrong?
reviews.title: Rough Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well, the room was so dark that I had to download the flashlight app to my iPad in order to just work the thermostat. And, in trying to get the temperature right, I learned that a window was open. I closed the window, and then learned that it didn't lock. Neither did the other window. Did I mention that I was on the 1st floor? (The 1st floor is actually their 3rd floor, but the windows here open directly onto a rooftop that is easily accessible.)
reviews.title: Looks and location get an A++, soundproofing gets an F
Nice stay.
reviews.text: I enjoyed my stay at the Empire hotel even though I initially had to change rooms. We checked into the first room and I instantly noticed that the noise from the air con was very loud and knew I wouldn't be able to sleep due to this, so I called reception and explained, they said to pop back downstairs and they instantly changed rooms to a better, bigger room with a good view! The room itself was very clean, comfy bed, usual hotel necessities. The bathroom was very small but it is New York after all, they stocked up with l'occitane toiletries everyday which is a nice quality touch.
One of the main features to this hotel is the rooftop pool and bar on an evening which we spent allot of time in both, brilliant place to chill out after a hectic day in the city.
reviews.title: Great stay in Empire

reviews.text: Overall I have no major complaints with the hotel and wouldn't rule out another visit to the property.
reviews.title: Made very welcome ,

reviews.text: The empire is a great hotel, very central for shopping, tourist activities. All staff were really nice, especially the concierge who got us tickets to Wicked and booked a great restaurant Azalea.
reviews.title: Overrated

reviews.text: Alot of people say rooms are small but we loved, how much room you need??
reviews.title: Compact rooms, pretty good service, stylish vibe

description: Nestled on our own private corner of West 63rd Street between two legendary New York City landmarks - Lincoln Center and Central Park - this boutique NYC hotel provides luxury accommodations overlooking the Broadway / Columbus Avenue - the gateway to the Upper West Side. Location is essential to the spirit of the Empire Hotel and the interior motif and design is inspired by the earth tones of Central Park and the stately modernism of Lincoln Center. 422 deluxe guest rooms and suites, WiFi, Pool Deck open seasonally, Ed's Chowder House Restaurant, Rooftop Lounge, Lobby bar.
